sentences: Naine tundis kohutavat hirmu vananemise ees.
See koer on meie t√§nava hirm.
context: The Estonian word 'hirm' is a noun that refers to fear, dread, terror, horror, or anxiety - an emotional state of agitation caused by perceived danger. It can also refer to frightening creatures or things, and in some contexts, tyranny or reign of terror. The word has declensions with forms like hirm (nominative singular), hirmu (genitive/partitive), hirmud (plural nominative), etc.
